intro: Jamesbrittenia tenella, commonly known as the slender Jamesbrittenia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and its role in the flora of Madagascar.
